title: Behind Trump's Greenland reversal: The crucial role of NATO chief Mark Rutte
subhead: The Dutchman, who has cultivated good relations with the American president, proposed transferring sovereignty over the Pituffik military base. These concessions still need to be approved by the Danish and Greenlandic authorities.

European Parliament thrusts EU-Mercosur trade deal into uncertainty
subhead: MEPs chose to refer the free trade agreement to the Court of Justice of the European Union, effectively freezing the ratification process. The EU Commission may, however, decide to provisionally apply the agreement in the meantime.

title: Myanmar: Murder of children is 'clearest indicator of genocidal intent'
subhead: The International Court of Justice has, since January 12, been examining the alleged genocide committed by Myanmar's army against the Rohingya Muslim minority. The case was referred to the top UN judicial body by The Gambia.

title: Paris men's fashion week: From the runway to live performance
subhead: Etudes Studio, Jeanne Friot, and Lemair: three labels choose cultural venues to bring a theatrical dimension to their collections.

title: Cohere's Joëlle Pineau: 'We aim for AI that creates value for businesses, not superintelligence'
subhead: The former number two in artificial intelligence research at Meta left Mark Zuckerberg's group to join the Canadian start-up.

'As it ceases to inspire, the US is losing part of itself'
subhead: Donald Trump's second term has turned the United States into a threat to which the rest of the world has no choice but to adapt. Yet, over the past eight decades, habits and practices have taken root that will be used to counter this new imperialism, writes Le Monde columnist Gilles Paris.

title: In one year, Trump has imposed a culture of impunity
subhead: Since returning to the White House, the American president has exempted himself from all rules, both domestically and internationally. This sense of impunity now permeates his entire administration.

title: Affordability has become a dominant political issue in the US
subhead: After months of dismissing rising prices as a 'Democratic scam,' Donald Trump is now making a series of announcements aimed at making, as the midterm elections approach.
